document_title: Acute cystitis: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content: Acute cystitis is recognized as a relatively benign disease. Most cases can be treated simply by taking short-term antibiotics. The disease only gets worse when the infection spreads to the kidneys with symptoms of high fever, back pain on one or both sides, and signs of kidney vibration. Most require hospitalization for treatment.
